revised_title: Discovery of Amorphous Starch in a New Tuberaceous Fungus
tldr: The author discovers amorphous starch in a new tuberaceous fungus, which is a rare occurrence in the fungal world. The fungus, named Amnylocarpus encephaloides, belongs to the Ascomycetes family and has a unique structure with curious sporidia that turn purple when exposed to iodine solution, indicating the presence of starch.
